title: Egypt's Captive
description: After plotting against his incompetent king, Han and his supporters are driven from the Hittite Empire and seek refuge in Egypt. Instead, he finds only suffering. Taken captive by Prince Itamun to ensure the village of refugees will follow the pharaoh's will, Han plots ways to turn the young prince's desire for him into a weapon. Soon, desire becomes a double-edged sword and it's no longer clear who's seducing whom.Itamun was sent to defend the borders of Egypt by his own father, Ramesses II. His heart heavy with the guilt of bloodshed, he's all too willing to seek relief in the arms of his captive. From the start, Han satisfies Itamun's dark needs for dominating a lover, desires Itamun never knew he had. But with so many scars on Han's soul, can Itamun ever convince his captive that they may have something more together than temporary pleasure?
author: C.D. Leavitt
